revised_title: Evidence of a Large Extinct Lizard (Notiosaurus dentatus) from Pleistocene Deposits in New South Wales, Australia
tldr: The author examines a fossilized mandible of a large extinct lizard, Notiosaurus dentatus, found in Pleistocene deposits in New South Wales, Australia. The fossil exhibits characteristics of a pleurodont lizard, which is different from the crocodile-like features initially hypothesized. The author also discusses the possibility of the extinct lizard being related to Megalania, another large Australian reptile.
